info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 4:03AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...AN INTENSE BAND OF LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CENTRAL ERIE AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTY... HAZARDS...A band of very heavy lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 3 to 5 inches per hour in the heart of the band, especially closer to the lakeshore. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 400 AM EST, an intense band of lake effect snow was located from just north of Orchard Park to just south of Buffalo and extending inland to the Elma, Lancaster and Cheektowaga areas. This band will continue to slowly progress northward through the early morning hours and will be squarely across the Buffalo Metro area for the busy morning commute. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Lackawanna, Depew, Lancaster, Williamsville, Elma, Small Boat Harbor, Erie Basin Marina, Blasdell, Elma Center, and Woodlawn Beach State Park. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 56. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
